title: Finding the Equation of an LSRL Using Means and SD
question_text: Consider a set of $n$ ordered pairs given by: $$({ x }_{ 1 },y_{ 1 }), ({ x }_{ 2 },y_{ 2 }), ({ x }_{ 3 },y_{ 3 }),...,({ x }_{ n },y_{ n })$$ The mean and standard deviation of the $x$ -values are $\bar { x } =10$ and ${ s }_{ x }=12$ . The mean and standard deviation of the $y$ -values $\bar { y } =15$ and ${ s }_{ y }=6$ . Which of the following could represent the least squares regression line?
